titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol grounds for the 13th annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Mr. Nadler moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Considered under suspension of the rules.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 3/24/1994--Introduced. Permits the National Fraternal Order of Police and its auxiliary to sponsor a public event, the 13th annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service, on the Capitol grounds on May 15, 1994.
